channel.title: ComicWeb Old Time Radio Programs
channel.itunes:subtitle: ComicWeb radio programs
channel.itunes:author: Jeff Joeckel
channel.itunes:summary: ComicWeb.com's Old Time Radio Program Podcast features an old time radio program each week. Including The Shadow, The Lone Ranger, Jack Benny, and many, many, more.
channel.description: ComicWeb.com presents old time radio programs and shows from the 30's 40' and 50's. Featuring such characters as Superman, The Green Hornet, The Shadow, the Lone Ranger, and more.

item.title: Inner Sanctum: The Judas Clock
item.itunes:author: ComicWeb
item.description: ComicWeb.com sells comics, old time radio programs and more
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date Apr 17, 1945
item.itunes:summary: Welcome to the inner Sanctum. Your host Raymond will now scare the bejesus out of you. The Inner Sanctum Old Time Radio Program is one of the best known OTR programs ever, and its influence can still be seen today. Every horror movie host with a wry, dark sense of humor owes its existence to this program.

item.title: Tarzan: The Decoy
item.itunes:author: ComicWeb
item.description: ComicWeb.com sells comics, old time radio programs and more
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date Jan 4, 1951
item.itunes:summary:
AAAAAAAAAAaaaaaaahhhhhhh-o-ahhhhhhhh-o-ahhhhhhhhhh-o
Tarzan of the Apes was written by Edgar Rice Burroughs in 1914. The novel told the story of an english noble family stranded on the African continent. Gorillas kill the mother and father, leaving their son, Lord Greystoke, to be raised by apes. The radio program aired from 1932-1936 then a new series ran from 1951-1953. Burroughs himself was involved with the early Tarzan radio episodes. In those early episodes, Burrough's daughter Joan played Jane, and her husband, James Pierce played Tarzan. Tarzan is considered to be the first major syndicated radio program.

item.title: Dimension X: Almost Human
item.itunes:author: ComicWeb
item.description: ComicWeb.com sells comics, old time radio programs and more
item.itunes:subtitle: original air date May 13/ 1950
item.itunes:summary: Dimension X was one of the few science fiction programs, but it may have been the best. The program showcased such great golden age science fiction writers as Ray Bradbury, Robert Bloch, Robert Heinlein, Isaac Asimov, and Kurt Vonnegut. The program was known for excellent scripts and high production values. Enjoy, and look out for bug eyed monsters.
